thread.title: Teignbridge Council boss Nicola Bulbeck who earns as much as the PM quits | Devon Live

title: Teignbridge Council boss Nicola Bulbeck who earns as much as the PM quits | Devon Live
text:
Comments (0) 
A council chief who is paid almost as much as the Prime Minister is leaving her post next month. Nicola Bulbeck, Teignbridge Council's CEO, told a meeting of the full council on Monday that she would be departing from her role on June 9 once she has fulfilled her duties as the Acting Returning Officer for the General Election. 
Ms Bulbeck faced criticism last year after it was revealed that she had been awarded an inflation-busting 12 per cent pay rise. Her total remuneration package, including pension contributions and benefits in kind, jumped from £126,097 in 2014/15 to £141,972 in the 2015/16 financial year, 
Theresa May currently receives £143,462 for leading the country, the Conservative Party and overseeing the hugely complicated Brexit process. Read more Row over whopping pay rise for council chief as salaries come under scrutiny 
Ms Bulbeck will not be directly replaced, but instead, her duties will be distributed between the existing officers and the Deputy Chief Executive, Phil Shears who will become the Head of Paid Service. 
A Teignbridge Council spokesman said: “Nicola Bulbeck will be leaving her post as the Chief Executive of Teignbridge District Council on June 9, 2017 after she has fulfilled her duties as the Acting Returning Officer for the General Election. Read more Tory revolt in Teignbridge as town council calls chief executive's 14% pay rise 'slap in the face' 
“She has served the Council in this position since 2006 and the Council wants to place on record its thanks to Nicola for her hard work and commitment during her time as Chief Executive. Her leadership and achievements during difficult and challenging times have made a significant impact local, regionally and nationally. We wish Nicola all the very best for the future. 
“Nicola wishes to place on record her thanks and respect for her Teignbridge colleagues, partners, businesses and members of the public with whom she has worked to deliver Teignbridge's priorities and to place it in a strong position going forward." 
No details about the reasons for Ms Bulbeck's departure or her future plans have been revealed.
